snippet: After a period of violent weather, the region’s sugar maples, birches and oaks are as much a source of terror as they are of pride.
abstract: New England residents are realizing that violent storms do happen there and region's sugar maple, birch and oak trees are no longer a source of pride, but of terror; Hurricane Sandy was not as destructive in New England as in other areas but its high winds still blew over tens of thousands of trees, pulling down utility lines; wreckage, costing hundreds of millions of dollars, and fear that it has engendered have led to something of a mini-war on trees.
lead_paragraph: After a period of violent weather, the region’s sugar maples, birches and oaks are as much a source of terror as they are of pride.

headline.seo: Storms Topple New England Trees, and Raise Fears
headline.main: Spate of Harsh Weather in New England Shifts Sentiment on Trees
headline.print_headline: Spate of Harsh Weather in New England Shifts Sentiment on Trees
